meanings.definition: To sell more of (something) than can be supplied or than exists
meanings.sent1: The store oversold their limited edition sneakers, leaving many customers disappointed.
meanings.sent2: The company had to issue refunds after they oversold their concert tickets.
meanings.sent3: The bakery oversold their famous cupcakes, causing a frenzy among dessert lovers.
meanings.sent4: The real estate agent oversold the benefits of the house, leading to buyer's remorse.
meanings.sent5: The online retailer oversold the product's features, resulting in negative reviews.

meanings.definition: The act of selling more of (something) than can be supplied or than exists
meanings.sent1: The oversale of the limited edition sneakers caused chaos at the store.
meanings.sent2: The oversale of concert tickets led to confusion among attendees.
meanings.sent3: The oversale of cupcakes at the bake sale left no treats for latecomers.
meanings.sent4: The oversale of the house's features made the buyer skeptical of the listing.
meanings.sent5: The oversale of the product's benefits resulted in a high return rate.
